Section 2 - Hospital and Surgical Expenses:
Hospital and Surgical Expenses Annual Limit covers when your helper is hospitalized due to an injury or illness and extends to cover Infectious Diseases with up to ninety days Pre and Post hospitalization or Day Surgery, providing sixty thousand dollars annual limit for Basic plan, sixty thousand dollars for Enhanced plan, eighty thousand dollars for Premier plan, and eighty thousand dollars for Exclusive plan.

Hospital Cash benefit provides no coverage for Basic plan, twenty dollars per day up to thirty days for Enhanced plan, thirty dollars per day up to thirty days for Premier plan, and fifty dollars per day up to thirty days for Exclusive plan.

Waiver of Co-Payment for Hospital and Surgical Expenses covers the twenty five percent co-payment payable by an employer with coverage provided for Enhanced, Premier, and Exclusive
questions: How does the Hospital and Surgical Expenses Annual Limit vary across the Basic, Enhanced, Premier, and Exclusive plans, and what is the maximum coverage period for Infectious Diseases including pre and post hospitalization?
What are the differences in Hospital Cash benefit amounts and maximum duration among the Enhanced, Premier, and Exclusive plans, and why is there no coverage for this benefit under the Basic plan?
Under which plans is the Waiver of Co-Payment for Hospital and Surgical Expenses applicable, what percentage of co-payment does it cover, and how does this interact with employer-paid co-payments?

How does the coverage for Infectious Diseases under Hospital and Surgical Expenses accommodate day surgery scenarios, and what are the implications for the 90-day pre and post hospitalization coverage window?
What are the annual premium costs associated with the Basic, Premier, and Exclusive plans, and how might these premiums relate to the respective Hospital and Surgical Expenses limits and benefits?

In the event of hospitalization due to an injury, how would the Hospital and Surgical Expenses Annual Limit and Hospital Cash benefit apply differently across the four plans, especially considering the absence of Hospital Cash in the Basic plan?

How does the policy define the scope of coverage for Infectious Diseases within the Hospital and Surgical Expenses section, and are there any exclusions or conditions that might limit this coverage during the 90-day pre and post hospitalization period?

What documentation or proof might be required to claim the Hospital Cash benefit, and how does the maximum number of payable days (up to 30) affect claims for prolonged hospital stays under the Premier and Exclusive plans?
How does the Waiver of Co-Payment benefit affect the insured's out-of-pocket expenses when hospitalized, and is this waiver applicable if the employer does not provide coverage for the co-payment?
Are there any differences in the Hospital and Surgical Expenses Annual Limit between the Enhanced and Premier plans, and how might these differences influence an insured's choice of plan?
How does the policy handle claims for day surgery under the Hospital and Surgical Expenses section, particularly in relation to the Infectious Diseases coverage and the annual limits for each plan?
What are the implications of the 90-day pre and post hospitalization coverage for Infectious Diseases on the timing of medical treatments and claims submissions?

How does the Hospital Cash benefit interact with the Hospital and Surgical Expenses coverage if an insured is hospitalized for an infectious disease, and are there any plan-specific exclusions that apply?

In cases where an insured's helper is hospitalized multiple times within a policy year, how does the annual limit for Hospital and Surgical Expenses apply, and does the Hospital Cash benefit reset for each hospitalization?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Waiver of Co-Payment benefit, and how does this benefit coordinate with other employer-provided health coverage or insurance plans?
How do the premium amounts for the Basic, Premier, and Exclusive plans correlate with the scope of coverage for Hospital and Surgical Expenses and the availability of Hospital Cash benefits?

If an insured under the Enhanced plan incurs hospital expenses exceeding the sixty thousand dollar annual limit, how are additional costs handled, and does the Hospital Cash benefit provide any supplementary financial support?

What are the policy provisions regarding coverage for infectious diseases that require hospitalization beyond the 90-day pre and post hospitalization period, and how might this affect claims under the Hospital and Surgical Expenses section?
How does the policy address co-payment responsibilities for insureds under the Basic plan, given that the Waiver of Co-Payment is not provided for this plan?
In what ways might the Hospital Cash benefit be impacted if an insured is hospitalized for reasons other than injury or infectious disease, and are there any plan-specific limitations or exclusions?
